intro: Bartschella albicans subsp. fraileana, commonly known as the white-flowered bartrachium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. This subspecies is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, typically growing in rocky or calcareous soils. It thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments and is often found in Mediterranean climates. The plant is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
